New Records: Finn Allen equalled the world record set by Hazratullah Zazai of Afghanistan of 16 sixes in a T20I innings
Key Match Events: Allen hit consecutive sixes from the second and third balls of the third over
Allen hit 6, 4, 4, 6, 6, 1 off Rauf in the sixth over
Allen's 50 came from only 26 balls and included three fours and five sixes
Allen finally was out in the 18th over when New Zealand was 203-4
Post-Match Reflections: Allen expressed pride in his performance
New Zealand took a winning 3-0 lead in the five-match series
Miscellaneous Highlights: Allen's sixes carried more than 100 meters, one passing over the crossbar and between the uprights of the rugby ground
Three of Allen's sixes were hit so far out of the ground that the ball could not be found and had to be replaced
Hazratullah set the six-hitting record when he scored 162 from 62 balls against Ireland in 2019
